text: Anthony Albanese has delivered his first major speech – one of three ‘vision’ statements - and also made his first real policy commitment. The opposition leader has vowed to implement ‘Jobs and Skills Australia’, a body designed to better match what is being taught in skills and vocation with what industry actually needs. “This will be a genuine partnership across all sectors,” the Labor leader said. “For the first time, I want this to be a data-driven exercise working in real-time with labour markets technology, like Seek and LinkedIn, to drive real outcomes.” Image: News Corp Australia
